data.title: American Idiot World Tour
data.meta_description: The American Idiot World Tour was a worldwide concert tour by the band Green Day, lasting from July 29, 2004 to December 17, 2005. The tour was to help show support for their newly released album, American Idiot across its 161 shows from North America, Europe, Oceania and Asia. It remains both...
data.text:
The American Idiot World Tour was a worldwide concert tour by the band Green Day, lasting from July 29, 2004 to December 17, 2005. The tour was to help show support for their newly released album, American Idiot across its 161 shows from North America, Europe, Oceania and Asia. It remains both the band's longest tour and the biggest tour by the number of shows.

Background[]

Prior to the release of American Idiot, Green Day first live premiered the singles "American Idiot" and "Jesus of Suburbia" at the Grand Olympic Auditorium in Los Angeles, California with later live premiering the entire album at the Fonda in Los Angeles, 5 days before the album was set to be released. The second round of shows in North America, which would become the fifth leg in the tour was announced near the end of the second leg in Europe in February of 2005. The third round of shows in North America, which would become the seventh leg in the tour was announced in May of 2005 near the end of the fifth leg. The tour wrapped up with a final leg with two shows in Oceania.

The tour would also be supported by opening artists with a total of 7 different bands preforming different shows. These included bands like My Chemical Romance, Simple Plan, Jimmy Eat World and Against Me! Since there wasn't a set schedule for bands to preform opening acts, one show could have multiple artists opening while the next show could have no opening artists present. For most of the shows throughout the tour, only Green Day would be present with no opening acts.

Bullet in a Bible[]

During leg sixth of the tour on the second round of Europe concerts, the band recorded the live album Bullet in a Bible during the June 18–19 concerts at the National Bowl in Milton Keynes, England where over 130,000 people attended the event. It would be released on November 15, 2005 with a majority of songs on the set list present within the album.

Set List[]

Throughout most of the tour, Green Day's set list remained consistent with most concerts featuring the most recognized songs from American Idiot, mixed in with other big hits. An average set list would contain around 15 songs from various albums, with an encore containing 4 various other songs. Some shows however, especially in earlier legs of the tour, would sometimes play the entirety of the album as the set list. The following is a incomplete list of most fully-played songs during the tour.

"2000 Light Years Away" "All By Myself" "American Idiot" "Are We the Waiting" "Basket Case" "Blitzkrieg Bop" (Ramones cover) "Boulevard of Broken Dreams" "Brain Stew" "Christie Road" "Dancing With Myself" (Generation X Cover) "Disappearing Boy" "Dominated Love Slave" "Ever Fallen in Love (With Someone You Shouldn't've)" (Buzzcocks cover) "Extraordinary Girl" "Geek Stink Breath" "Give Me Novacaine" "Good Riddance (Time of Your Life)" "Hitchin' a Ride" "Holiday" "Homecoming" "I Fought The Law" (The Crickets cover) "J.A.R. (Jason Andrew Relva)" "Jaded" "Jesus of Suburbia" "King for a Day" "Knowledge" (Operation Ivy cover) "Letterbomb" "Longview" "Maria" "Minority" "Nice Guys Finish Last" "She" "She's a Rebel" "Shout" (The Isley Brothers cover) "St. Jimmy" "Stand By Me" (Ben E. King cover) "Waiting" "Wake Me Up When September Ends" "We Are the Champions" (Queen cover) "Welcome to Paradise" "Whatsername" "When I Come Around"

Oceania December 14, 2005 Sydney Australia Sydney Cricket Ground December 17, 2005 Melbourne Telstra Dome

Reception[]

From the entirety of the American Idiot World Tour, the band have estimated to gross at least $70 million across its 161 shows during its run. The total amount of tickets sold during the tour is estimated to be over 1.5 million tickets, and with support of the album, the total number of units sold was over 3 million in 2005 alone, with over 15 million worldwide as of 2022. In total, Bullet in a Bible would end up selling over 1.5 million units on DVD, going platinum in the U.S. and U.K.

Personnel[]

Green Day

Billie Joe Armstrong – Lead vocals, lead and rhythm guitar

Mike Dirnt – Bass, backing vocals, lead vocals on "Homecoming" (Nobody likes you)

Tré Cool – Drums, percussion, backing vocals on "King For A Day/Shout", lead vocals on "Homecoming" (Rock'n'roll Girlfriend)

Additional Musicians

Jason White – Lead and rhythm guitar, backing vocals

Jason Freese – Keyboards, saxophone, trombone, accordion, acoustic guitar, backing vocals

Kurt Lohmiller – (July 2004 – Late January 2005) – backing vocals, percussion, trumpet

Ronnie Blake – (Late January 2005 – December 2005) – backing vocals, percussion, trumpet

Mike Pelino (September 2004 & April 2005 – December 2005) – Rhythm guitar, backing vocals on "St. Jimmy"

Bobby Schneck (October 2004 – March 2005) – Rhythm guitar, backing vocals on "St. Jimmy"

Opening Act Artists

Kaiser Chiefs - opening act

My Chemical Romance - opening act

Simple Plan - opening act

New Found Glory - opening act

Sugarcult - opening act

Jimmy Eat World - opening act

Against Me! - opening act
